ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Abashi responds to the lullaby thread
ygData.msgSnippet: Obvious to everyone who actually plays a bard that is, which apparently does not include anyone of note at Verant.  This has been my complaint since the
ygData.messageBody:
Obvious to everyone who actually plays a bard that is, which apparently does
not include anyone of note at Verant. This has been my complaint since the
beginning. Many of the classes have someone at Verant who really 'cares'
about the class. As such, those classes are constantly observed for effects
that changes might have on them and what improvements might be needed for
them. Unfortunately, it is all too apparent that bards have no such
advocate.

Kit

BTW, Been playing my druid a bit more than usual of late due to frustration
with bard stuff. Gads do druids have it easy, at least up to 25th level.
I can't get over how much easier it is to play my druid than my bard. If it
wasn't for the fact that I really am much more of a bard at heart I'd switch
over permanently.

-----Original Message-----
From: kim@... [mailto:kim@...]
Sent: Friday, March 03, 2000 1:52 PM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Abashi responds to the lullaby thread


From: <kim@...>

See? I told you it was good that they fixed the message,
because it'd make it completely obvious to everyone just how
high the secondary resist rate was. :)

--
John H. Kim
